# Hot Young Bloods: A Korean Comedy-Drama About Teenage Love and Rivalry
  
Hot Young Bloods is a 2014 Korean movie that tells the story of a group of high school students in a rural town in the 1980s. The movie focuses on the relationships and conflicts among four main characters: Young-Sook (Park Bo-Young), a tough and fearless gang leader; Joong-Gil (Lee Jong-Suk), a charming and popular playboy; Gwang-Sik (Kim Young-Kwang), a rival gang leader who has a crush on Young-Sook; and So-Hee (Lee Se-Young), a new transfer student who catches Joong-Gil's eye.

The movie is a mix of romance, comedy, drama, friendship, and youth. It depicts the struggles and joys of growing up, falling in love, and finding oneself. The movie also showcases the vibrant and nostalgic atmosphere of the 1980s, with its fashion, music, culture, and slang.
  
Hot Young Bloods was directed by Lee Yeon-Woo and written by Lee Yeon-Woo and Lee Man-Hee. It was released in January 2014 and received positive reviews from critics and audiences. It was praised for its witty dialogue, realistic characters, humorous situations, and heartfelt emotions. It also won several awards, including Best New Actress for Park Bo-Young at the 51st Baeksang Arts Awards.
